question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: postgres_uri] [Credential exposure] Can the postgres_uri field containing sensitive database credentials be logged or exposed through error messages in unexpected code paths, potentially leaking database access to unauthorized parties? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: fmt()] [Information disclosure] Does the Debug implementation's URL password masking at lines 94-99 properly handle all edge cases, or can malformed URLs bypass the password redaction and expose credentials in logs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: fmt()] [Password leakage] If url::Url::parse() fails with expect() at line 95, will the panic message include the raw postgres_uri with unmasked credentials, leaking the database password? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Credential injection] Can an attacker set the INDEXER_DATABASE_URL environment variable to inject a malicious postgres connection string that redirects indexer data to an attacker-controlled database? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [SQL injection prep] Does the postgres_uri validation at lines 138-145 check for SQL injection characters or malicious connection parameters that could be exploited when the URI is used for database connections? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Integer overflow] Can an attacker provide extremely large batch_size values (u16 max: 65535) that, when cast from u64 to u16 at lines 176-180, cause integer overflow or wraparound leading to incorrect batch processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Integer overflow] Can setting batch_size to values near u16::MAX cause overflow when multiplied with other parameters like fetch_tasks or processor_tasks in dependent code, leading to memory exhaustion or incorrect indexing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Type cast vulnerability] Does the conversion from u64 to u8 for fetch_tasks at lines 181-185 properly handle values exceeding u8::MAX (255), or will values 256+ silently truncate causing loss of parallelism configuration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Type cast vulnerability] Does the processor_tasks conversion from u64 to u8 at lines 186-190 validate that values don't exceed 255, or can configuration with large values silently fail leading to single-threaded processing and severe performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: default_if_zero()] [Logic bypass] Can an attacker exploit the default_if_zero() function at lines 202-209 by providing Option::None to bypass intended default values and force zero-value configurations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: env_var_or_default()] [Panic attack] Can an attacker crash the indexer by leaving critical environment variables like INDEXER_DATABASE_URL unset when postgres_uri is None, triggering the panic at lines 220-226 and causing DoS? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Version manipulation] Can an attacker set STARTING_VERSION environment variable to u64::MAX causing the indexer to skip all historical data and start from an impossibly high version, breaking indexer functionality? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Error suppression] Does the STARTING_VERSION parsing error handling at lines 158-171 with warn!() allow attackers to silently force fallback to None/default by providing unparseable values, potentially causing data inconsistency? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: env_var_or_default()] [Type confusion] Can the generic FromStr parsing at line 218 be exploited with type confusion attacks when parsing environment variables for different types (String vs u64 vs bool)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Injection attack] Can an attacker inject malicious processor names via PROCESSOR_NAME environment variable at lines 148-155 that execute arbitrary code when the processor is loaded dynamically? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Constant: PROCESSOR_NAME] [Command injection] Does the processor field validated at lines 148-155 check for path traversal or command injection characters (../, $()), allowing execution of malicious processor modules? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Resource exhaustion] Can an attacker set batch_size to 1 and fetch_tasks/processor_tasks to 255 each, creating 65,025 concurrent operations that exhaust system resources and crash the indexer? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: gap_lookback_versions] [Memory exhaustion] Can setting gap_lookback_versions to u64::MAX at lines 192-196 cause the indexer to attempt loading billions of versions into memory, leading to OOM crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: emit_every] [Logic error] Can setting emit_every to 0 at line 191 with the comment 'Set to 0 to disable' cause division-by-zero errors in logging code that calculates progress percentages? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: batch_size] [Performance attack] Can an attacker set batch_size to u16::MAX (65535) forcing the indexer to fetch massive batches that timeout or exhaust node resources, degrading network performance? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Constant: DEFAULT_BATCH_SIZE] [Configuration weakness] Is the default batch size of 500 at line 20 too large for constrained environments, potentially causing memory issues on low-resource indexers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Race condition] Can concurrent calls to optimize() on the same NodeConfig cause race conditions when modifying indexer_config fields at lines 127-197, leading to inconsistent configuration state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: check_chain_id] [Chain confusion] Can disabling check_chain_id (set to false) at line 175 allow an indexer to process transactions from the wrong chain (testnet vs mainnet), leading to incorrect indexing and data corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: check_chain_id] [Configuration bypass] Does the default value of Some(true) for check_chain_id at line 175 get properly enforced, or can it be bypassed by setting it to None instead of Some(false)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: starting_version] [Replay attack] Can an attacker set starting_version to 0 at lines 158-171 to force reprocessing of all historical transactions, potentially exploiting old vulnerabilities or causing data duplication? (High)
